page.title: 02GOODWOOD HOUSE
page.content: In Goodwood House there are many fascinating family portraits. There are paintings of London and Venice and three horse hunting at Goodwood. There are many objects once owned by famous people. There is a plate that Napoleon used at breakfast on the morning of the Battle of Waterloo. There is also Queen Victoria's walking stick and Bonny Prince Charlie's travelling moneybox. Goodwood house was originally built as a hunting lodge in 1616. In the long hall there is a picture of the local hunt (by Stubbs) and a picture showing the hunting lodge as it was in 1746 (by Wooten). The house was bought by the first Duke of Richmond in 1694 and has been the home of the Dukes since then. By Rebecca G
